issue.title: std::array initialization is still not permissive enough

discussion.p: should be fine, but isn't guaranteed, since {0} has no type. We should rather go for implicit conversion:

blockquote.p: An array is an aggregate () that can be list-initialized with up to N elements whose types are convertible to Tthat can be implicitly converted to T.

discussion.p: Priority 2; consensus is that the P/R is not quite right.
discussion.note: 2018-3-14 Wednesday evening issues processing; priority to 3; move to Open
discussion.p: Jens: There's nothing you can do about the double braces in std::array. That's a core thing.
STL to write paper to resolve this.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4606.

blockquote.p: -2- An array is an aggregate () that can be list-initialized with up to N elements whose types are convertiblethat can be implicitly converted to T.
